meanings.definition: To step to one side in order to avoid something.
meanings.sent1: She had to sidestep the puddle on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The cat tried to sidestep the dog chasing after it.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to sidestep the acorn falling from the tree.
meanings.sent4: He had to sidestep the issue during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's graceful sidestep avoided a collision on stage.

meanings.definition: A step taken to one side in order to avoid something.
meanings.sent1: His quick sidestep saved him from bumping into the wall.
meanings.sent2: The player's sidestep helped him dodge the opponent's tackle.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's sidestep of the banana peel got a big laugh from the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her sidestep around the puddle kept her shoes clean.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's precise sidestep avoided stepping on a landmine.
